statements.name: PROC GMAP
statements.description: Identifies the map data set and the response data set that contain the variables associated with the map. The statement also provides the option to display all map areas and to specify annotation and an output catalog.
statements.help:
PROC GMAP 
            MAP=map-data-set
            
	DATA=response-data-set
	
            <ALL>
	
            <ANNOTATE=Annotate-data-set>
            
	
            <DENSITY=0-6 |  LOW | MEDIUM | HIGH>
	
            <GOUT=<libref.>output-catalog>
	
            <IMAGEMAP=output-data-set>
	<LATLON>
	<RESOLUTION=1-10 | AUTO | NONE>
	<STRETCH>
	
            <UNIFORM>;                   
	ID 
                id-variable(s); 
            
	AREA 
               response-variable
               </ options>;
            
	BLOCK 
               response-variable(s)
               </ options>;
            
	CHORO 
               response-variable(s)
               </ options>;
            
	PRISM 
               response-variable(s)
               </ options>;
            
	SURFACE 
               response-variable(s)
               </ options>;
            
	ATTRIB  variable-list(s) 
               attribute-list(s);
            
	BY 
               <DESCENDING>
               variable-1
		< ... <DESCENDING> variable-n>
               
		<NOTSORTED>;
            
            
	FORMAT 
               variable-1
               < ...variable-n>
               <format-1>
               <variable-1< ...variable-n><format-2>>
                ...
               <DEFAULT=default-format>;
            
	LABEL 
               variable-1=label-1 | ' '
               <variable-n=label-n | ' '>
                ...;
            
	NOTE <text-arguments(s)>;
            
	QUIT ;
            
	WHERE 
               where-expression;

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: identifies the SAS data set that contains the response values or the response values and the spatial information that are evaluated and represented on the map. If not specified, a response data set must have been created before issuing the PROC GMAP statement.

arguments.name: MAP=
arguments.description: names a map data set that contains either the X and Y or LAT and LONG coordinates, or all, for the boundary points of each map area.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: specifies that the maps generated by the procedure should include all of the map areas from the map data set. This occurs even if the response data set does not include an observation for the map area.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: specifies a data set to annotate all of the maps that are produced by the GMAP procedure.

arguments.name: DENSITY=
arguments.description: for maps that have a DENSITY variable, specifies the density of map observations that are used.

The value that you specify indicates the maximum value that the DENSITY variable can have for the observation to be displayed. For example, if you specify DENSITY=5, then only observations in the map data set whose DENSITY value is less than or equal to 5 are displayed.

arguments.name: LOW
arguments.description: LOW is equivalent to DENSITY= 1.

arguments.name: MEDIUM
arguments.description: MEDIUM is equivalent to DENSITY= 3.

arguments.name: HIGH
arguments.description: HIGH is equivalent to DENSITY= 6.

arguments.name: GOUT=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS catalog in which to save the graphics output that is produced by the GMAP procedure for later replay.

arguments.name: IMAGEMAP=
arguments.description: creates a temporary SAS data set that is used to generate an image map.

arguments.name: LATLON
arguments.description: specifies that the LAT and LONG variables from the map data set are used for coordinate data instead of the Y and X variables.

arguments.name: RESOLUTION=
arguments.description: for maps that have a RESOLUTION variable, specifies the resolution level of map observations that are used.

The integer correlates to the number of pixels displayed on the map. A low resolution value indicates that a smaller number of pixels is displayed. For example, a RESOLUTION value of 4 equates to 800 x 600 pixels displayed.

arguments.name: AUTO
arguments.description: Specifying AUTO defaults to the resolution setting of the device being used in the GMAP procedure.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: A RESOLUTION set to NONE indicates that the DENSITY option, if specified, is used instead.

arguments.name: STRETCH
arguments.description: stretches map extents to cover all available space in the device. This might cause the map to be distorted.

arguments.name: UNIFORM
arguments.description: causes the same legend and coloring to be used for all maps produced by the procedure instead of being calculated within each BY group for each map.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: Identifies the variable or variables in the input data set(s) that define map areas.

arguments.name: id-variable
arguments.description: identifies one or more variables in the map and response data sets that define a map area. This argument is used only when map and response data sets are specified.

statements.name: AREA
statements.description: applies color to the regions in BLOCK and PRISM maps based on values of a specified response variable.

arguments.name: response-variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable in the response data set. Areas that correspond to response variables with missing values are not colored unless you use the MISSING option in the AREA statement. This variable is represented in all BLOCK and PRISM maps in the same RUN group.

arguments.name: DISCRETE
arguments.description: generates a separate response level (color and surface pattern) for each different value of the formatted response variable.

arguments.name: LEGEND=
arguments.description: specifies the global LEGEND statement to associate with the map.

arguments.name: LEVELS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of response levels to be graphed for the response variable.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: specifies the response levels for the range of response values that are represented by each level (pattern and color combination).

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: accepts a missing value as a valid level for the response variable.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: suppresses the legend.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: specifies that the GMAP procedure collect all response values (or their statistic) and chart each region as a percentage of the whole.

arguments.name: RANGE
arguments.description: causes GMAP to display, in the legend, the starting value and ending value of the range around each midpoint specified with the MIDPOINTS= option (instead of displaying just the midpoints).

arguments.name: STATFMT=
arguments.description: overrides the GMAP default format for percent of PERCENT8.2.

arguments.name: STATISTIC=
arguments.description: specifies the statistic for the GMAP procedure to chart.

arguments.name: UNIFORM
arguments.description: causes the same legend and coloring to be used for all maps produced by the procedure instead of being calculated within each BY group for each map.

statements.name: BLOCK
statements.description: Creates three-dimensional block maps on which levels of magnitude of the specified response variables are represented by blocks (bars) of varying height, pattern, and color.

arguments.name: response-variable
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables in the response data set. Each response variable produces a separate map. All variables must be in the input data set. Multiple response variables are separated with blanks. Blocks are not drawn for the response variable with missing values unless you use the MISSING option in the BLOCK statement.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: specifies a data set to annotate onto maps that are produced by the BLOCK statement.

arguments.name: AREA=
arguments.description: specifies that a different map pattern be used for the surface of each map area or group of map areas on the map.

arguments.name: BLOCKSIZE=
arguments.description: specifies the width of the blocks.

arguments.name: CBLKOUT=
arguments.description: outlines all blocks in the specified color.

arguments.name: CDEFAULT=
arguments.description: fills empty map areas in the specified color.

arguments.name: CEMPTY=
arguments.description: outlines empty map areas in the specified color.

arguments.name: COUTLINE=
arguments.description: outlines non-empty map areas in the specified color.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: specifies a color for the text in the legend.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: specifies a description of the output.

arguments.name: DISCRETE
arguments.description: generates a separate response level (color and surface pattern) for each different value of the formatted response variable.

arguments.name: HTML=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: HTML_LEGEND=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: LEGEND=
arguments.description: specifies the global LEGEND statement to associate with the map.

arguments.name: LEVELS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of response levels to be graphed for the response variable.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: specifies the response levels for the range of response values that are represented by each level (pattern and color combination).

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: accepts a missing value as a valid level for the response variable.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the GRSEG catalog entry and the name of the graphics output file, if one is created.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: suppresses the legend.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: specifies that the GMAP procedure collect all response values (or their statistic) and chart each region as a percentage of the whole.

arguments.name: RANGE
arguments.description: displays value ranges in the legend.

arguments.name: RELZERO
arguments.description: creates bars and regions that are relative to a zero value.

arguments.name: SHAPE=
arguments.description: specifies the shape of the blocks.

arguments.name: STATFMT=
arguments.description: overrides the GMAP default format for percent of PERCENT8.2.

arguments.name: STATISTIC=
arguments.description: specifies the statistic for the GMAP procedure to chart.

arguments.name: STRETCH
arguments.description: stretches map extents to cover all available space in the device.

arguments.name: UNIFORM
arguments.description: causes the same legend and coloring to be used for all maps produced by the procedure instead of being calculated within each BY group for each map.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies a character variable whose values are URLs.

arguments.name: WOUTLINE=
arguments.description: specifies the width, in pixels, of the outline for all outlined blocks and for the outline of the map areas.

arguments.name: XSIZE=
arguments.description: specify the physical width dimension of the map to be drawn.

arguments.name: YSIZE=
arguments.description: specify the physical height dimension of the map to be drawn.

arguments.name: XVIEW=
arguments.description: specify coordinates of the viewing position in the reference coordinate system.

statements.name: CHORO
statements.description: Creates two-dimensional maps in which values of the specified response variables are represented by varying patterns and colors.

arguments.name: response-variable
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables in the response data set. Each response variable produces a separate map. All variables must be in the input data set. Multiple response variables are separated with blanks.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: specifies a data set to annotate onto maps that are produced by the CHORO statement.

arguments.name: CDEFAULT=
arguments.description: fills empty map areas in the specified color.

arguments.name: CEMPTY=
arguments.description: outlines empty map areas in the specified color.

arguments.name: COUTLINE=
arguments.description: outlines non-empty map areas in the specified color.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: specifies a color for the text in the legend.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: specifies a description of the output.

arguments.name: DISCRETE
arguments.description: generates a separate response level (color and surface pattern) for each different value of the formatted response variable.

arguments.name: HTML=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: HTML_LEGEND=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: LEGEND=
arguments.description: assigns the specified global LEGEND statement that is to be applied to the map.

arguments.name: LEVELS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of response levels to be graphed for the response variable.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: specifies the response levels for the range of response values that are represented by each level (pattern and color combination).

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: accepts a missing value as a valid level for the response variable.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the GRSEG catalog entry and the name of the graphics output file, if one is created.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: suppresses the legend.

arguments.name: OSM
arguments.description: specifies an OpenStreetMap (OSM) style and can project the unprojected map areas from latitude and longitude degrees onto the OSM map.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: specifies that the GMAP procedure collect all response values (or their statistic) and chart each region as a percentage of the whole.

arguments.name: RANGE
arguments.description: displays value ranges in the legend.

arguments.name: STATFMT=
arguments.description: overrides the GMAP default format for percent of PERCENT8.2.

arguments.name: STATISTIC=
arguments.description: specifies the statistic for the GMAP procedure to chart.

arguments.name: STRETCH
arguments.description: stretches map extents to cover all available space in the device.

arguments.name: UNIFORM
arguments.description: causes the same legend and coloring to be used for all maps produced by the procedure instead of being calculated within each BY group for each map.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies a character variable whose values are URLs.

arguments.name: WOUTLINE=
arguments.description: specifies the width of all map area outlines, in pixels.

arguments.name: XSIZE=
arguments.description: specify the physical width or height dimension of the map.

statements.name: PRISM
statements.description: Creates three-dimensional prism maps in which levels of magnitude of the specified response variables are represented by polyhedrons (raised polygons) of varying height, pattern, and color.

arguments.name: response-variable
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables in the response data set. Each response variable produces a separate map. All variables must be in the input data set. Multiple response variables are separated with blanks.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: specifies a data set to annotate onto the maps that are produced by the PRISM statement.

arguments.name: AREA=
arguments.description: specifies that a different map pattern be used for the surface of each map area or group of map areas on the map.

arguments.name: CDEFAULT=
arguments.description: fills empty map areas in the specified color.

arguments.name: CEMPTY=
arguments.description: outlines empty map areas in the specified color.

arguments.name: COUTLINE=
arguments.description: outlines nonempty map areas in the specified color.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description:
specifies a color for the text in the legend. If you omit the CTEXT= option, a color specification is searched for in this order:
• the CTEXT= option in a                                  GOPTIONS statement.
• the default, the text                                  color that is specified in the current style.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: specifies a description of the output.

arguments.name: DISCRETE
arguments.description: generates a separate response level (color and surface pattern) for each different value of the formatted response variable.

arguments.name: HTML=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: HTML_LEGEND=
arguments.description: identifies the variable in the input data set whose values create links or data tips or both.

arguments.name: LEGEND=
arguments.description: specifies the global LEGEND definition to associate with the map.

arguments.name: LEVELS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of response levels to be graphed for the response variable.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: specifies the response levels for the range of response values that are represented by each level (prism height, pattern, and color combination).

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: accepts a missing value as a valid level for the response variable.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the GRSEG catalog entry and the name of the graphics output file, if one is created.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: suppresses the legend.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: specifies that the GMAP procedure collect all response values (or their statistic) and chart each region as a percentage of the whole.

arguments.name: RANGE
arguments.description: causes GMAP to display, in the legend, the starting value and ending value of the range around each midpoint specified with the MIDPOINTS= option (instead of displaying just the midpoints). For example, if MIDPOINTS=15 25 35, then the legend could show 10-20, 20-30, 30-40.

arguments.name: RELZERO
arguments.description: creates area heights that are relative to a zero value.

arguments.name: STATFMT=
arguments.description: overrides the GMAP default format for percent of PERCENT8.2.

arguments.name: STATISTIC=
arguments.description: specifies the statistic for the GMAP procedure to chart.

arguments.name: STRETCH
arguments.description: stretches map extents to cover all available space in the device.

arguments.name: UNIFORM
arguments.description: causes the same legend and coloring to be used for all maps produced by the procedure instead of being calculated within each BY group for each map.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies a character variable whose values are URLs.

arguments.name: WOUTLINE=
arguments.description: specifies the width, in pixels, of all map area outlines.

arguments.name: XLIGHT=
arguments.description: specify the coordinates of the imaginary light source in the map coordinate system.

arguments.name: XSIZE=
arguments.description: specify the physical width dimension of the map to be drawn.

arguments.name: YSIZE=
arguments.description: specify the physical height dimension of the map to be drawn.

arguments.name: XVIEW=
arguments.description: specify coordinates of the viewing position in the reference coordinate system.

statements.name: SURFACE
statements.description: Creates three-dimensional surface maps in which levels of magnitude of the specified response variables are represented by spikes of varying height.

arguments.name: response-variable
arguments.description: specifies one or more variables in the response data set. The response-variable must be numeric and must contain only positive values. Each response variable produces a separate map. All variables must be in the input data set. Multiple response variables are separated with blanks.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: specifies a data set to annotate onto maps that are produced by the SURFACE statement.

arguments.name: CBODY=
arguments.description: specifies the color that is used to draw the surface map.

arguments.name: CONSTANT=
arguments.description: specifies a denominator to use in the distance decay function.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: specifies a description of the output.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the GRSEG catalog entry and the name of the graphics output file, if one is created.

arguments.name: NLINES=
arguments.description: specifies the number of lines used to draw the surface map.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: specifies that the GMAP procedure collect all response values (or their statistic) and chart each region as a percentage of the whole.

arguments.name: ROTATE=
arguments.description: specifies the degrees of the angle at which to rotate the map about the Z axis in the map coordinate system.

arguments.name: STATFMT=
arguments.description: overrides the default format for percent of PERCENT8.2 that is used by the GMAP procedure.

arguments.name: STATISTIC=
arguments.description: specifies the statistic for the GMAP procedure to chart.

arguments.name: TILT=
arguments.description: specifies the degrees of the angle at which to tilt the map about the X axis in the map coordinate system.

arguments.name: XSIZE=
arguments.description: specify the physical width dimension of the map to be drawn.

arguments.name: YSIZE=
arguments.description: specify the physical height dimension of the map to be drawn.

statements.name: ATTRIB
statements.description: Associates a format, informat, label, and length with one or more variables.

arguments.name: variable-list
arguments.description: names the variables that you want to associate with the attributes.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: associates a format with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: INFORMAT=
arguments.description: associates an informat with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: associates a label with variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: LENGTH=
arguments.description: specifies the length of variables in variable-list.

arguments.name: TRANSCODE=
arguments.description: specifies whether character variables can be transcoded. Use TRANSCODE=NO to suppress transcoding. Variables with TRANSCODE=NO are not returned.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Orders the output according to the BY groups.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the variable that the procedure uses to form BY groups. You can specify more than one variable. If you do not use the NOTSORTED option in the BY statement, then either the observations in the data set must be sorted by all the variables that you specify, or they must be indexed appropriately. Variables in a BY statement are called BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order. The observations are grouped in another way (for example, chronological order).

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: names one or more variables for SAS to associate with a format. You must specify at least one variable.

arguments.name: format
arguments.description: specifies the format that is listed for writing the values of the variables.

arguments.name: DEFAULT=
arguments.description: specifies a temporary default format for displaying the values of variables that are not listed in the FORMAT statement. These default formats apply only to the current DATA step; they are not permanently associated with variables in the output data set.

statements.name: LABEL
statements.help:
Form 1: Creates a descriptive label for one or more variables.
LABEL  variable-1=’text-string’ < ...variable-n=’text-string>; 
Form 2: Removes the label from one or more variables.
LABEL  variable-1 = ' ' < ...variable-n=’ ‘>; | variable-1 = < ...variable-n= >

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: specifies a label of up to 256 bytes.
removes a label from a variable. Enclose a single blank space in quotation marks to remove an existing label. You can remove labels from multiple variables in a single LABEL statement:

statements.name: NOTE
statements.description: Control the content, appearance, and placement of text.

arguments.name: ALT=
arguments.description: specifies descriptive text for a URL to which a note links, or the note itself.

arguments.name: ANGLE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle of the baseline of the entire text string with respect to the horizontal.

arguments.name: BCOLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the background color of a box produced by the BOX= option.

arguments.name: BLANK=
arguments.description: protects the box and its contents from being overwritten by any subsequent graphics elements.

arguments.name: BOX=
arguments.description: draws a box around one line of text.

arguments.name: BSPACE=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of space between the boxed text and the box.

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the color for the following text, box, or line.

arguments.name: DRAW=
arguments.description: draws lines anywhere on the graphics output area.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: specifies the font for the subsequent text.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the height of text characters in number of units.

arguments.name: JUSTIFY=
arguments.description: specifies the alignment of the text string.

arguments.name: LEFT
arguments.description: aligns the text to the left.

arguments.name: CENTER
arguments.description: aligns the text in the center.

arguments.name: RIGHT
arguments.description: aligns the text to the right.

arguments.name: LANGLE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle of the entire text-string(s).

arguments.name: LINK=
arguments.description: specifies a uniform resource locator (URL) to which a note links.

arguments.name: LSPACE=
arguments.description: specifies the amount of spacing above and below lines of text.

arguments.name: MOVE=
arguments.description: positions a text string.

arguments.name: ROTATE=
arguments.description: specifies the angle at which each character of text is rotated.

arguments.name: UNDERLIN=
arguments.description: underlines subsequent text.

arguments.name: WRAP
arguments.description: wraps the text to a second line if the text does not fit on one line.

arguments.name: #BYLINE
arguments.description: substitutes the entire BY line without leading or trailing blanks for #BYLINE in the text string. It also displays the BY line in the note produced by the statement.

arguments.name: #BYVAL
arguments.description: substitutes the current value of the specified BY variable for #BYVAL in the text string and displays the value produced by the statement. Specify the variable with one of these values:

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies which variable in the BY statement #BYVAL should use. The value of n indicates the position of the variable in the BY statement.

arguments.name: variable-name
arguments.description: names the BY variable.

arguments.name: #BYVAR
arguments.description: substitutes the name of the BY variable or label associated with the variable (whatever the BY line would normally display) for #BYVAR in the text string and displays the name or label produced by the statement. Specify the variable with one of these:

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies which variable in the BY statement #BYVAR should use. The value of n indicates the position of the variable in the BY statement. For example, #BYVAR2 specifies the second variable in the BY statement.

arguments.name: BY-variable-name
arguments.description: names the BY variable. For example, #BYVAR(SITES) specifies the BY variable, SITES. Variable-name is not case sensitive.

statements.name: QUIT
statements.description: Executes any statements that have not executed and ends the procedure step.

statements.name: WHERE
statements.description: Subsets the input data set by specifying certain conditions that each observation must meet before it is available for processing.

arguments.name: where-expression
arguments.description: is an arithmetic or logical expression that generally consists of a sequence of operands and operators. For more information about where processing, see .
